item.title: Build A Beehive Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Build A Beehive’s October 2025 monthly codes can be used to redeem various rewards in the game, with cash being the most sought-after resource. Read on to find out what the latest Build A Beehive active codes are. 

Build A Beehive is a popular simulation-based tycoon Roblox game where the player is in charge of the complete operation of a bee farm. This includes activities like growing plants, attracting and tending to the bees, producing honey, and, in the end, selling the honey that’s been produced for the maximum possible profit. Players begin the game with a tiny plot of land and are tasked with buying some flavors to plant.

These flowers attract different kinds of bees, and maintaining the right balance is of utmost importance. Although simply progressing through the game will give players the resources they need to upgrade both their land as well as their farm, using some Build A Beehive codes to get a small boost will certainly be worth the while. 

Active Build A Beehive Codes

  • E8CA45: 500 Cash (NEW, limited use)

Expired Build A Beehive Codes

  • QueenBeeWait
  • SummerEvent

How To Redeem Build A Beehive Codes

Redeeming codes in Roblox Build A Beehive is a fairly straightforward process, as the developers do not impose any prerequisite steps on the players. Some Roblox games nowadays require players to complete certain tasks, such as following the game’s socials or joining the official Discord server, before the code redemption feature is unlocked for them. This game, however, has no such steps, and it’s just a matter of inputting one of the codes into the correct text box by navigating through the menus.

For players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem, here’s a step-by-step guide to redeeming these codes:

  1. Launch Roblox and open up Build A Beehive.
  2. Click the Shop icon on the left side of the screen.
  3. Input one of the active codes into the ‘Codes’ text box.
  4. Click on the ‘Redeem’ button to claim your rewards.

How To Get More Build A Beehive Codes

The easiest way for players to get their hands on the latest codes would be to simply follow this page by bookmarking it, although they are released by the developers through the official Discord server.

The developers often release new codes during updates or in-game events, and that pattern is expected to continue. Visit this page every so often to stay up to date on the latest codes, as we update this page immediately after new codes drop. 

While you’re enjoying Roblox, check out our code guides for other games, such as 99 Nights in the Forest, Squid Game X, and Pressure. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Is Escape From Duckov On PlayStation, Xbox, Or Nintendo Switch? PS5 & Xbox Series X|S Console Status Explained
item.content:encoded:
Escape From Duckov may sound suspiciously like another game, but it’s very different. It’s why the game has sold like hotcakes, PC players can’t get enough of it, and why its indie status has PlayStation and Xbox owners don’t know if it’s on PS5 or Xbox Series X|S.

At first glance, Escape From Duckov sounds like a novelty rip-off movie from the mid-2000s where everyone was trying to do their own Scary Movie imitation. However, at the core of Escape From Duckov is a very competent extraction shooter with a cute and cuddly theme that bolsters its game world, rather than hindering and overshadowing it.

It rightly takes the bill at launch, and we’re going to duck here so we don’t catch any strays from Escape From Tarkov fans. If you want to know if Escape From Duckov is coming to consoles—specifically PlayStation, Xbox, and PC—let’s take a look at what we know.

Can You Play Escape From Duckov On PS5 Or PS4?

As of writing, you can’t play Escape From Duckov on any PlayStation consoles, and this includes the PS4, the PS5, and any of the PlayStation Pro models.

It’s not a matter of consoles being unable to run Escape From Duckov, so you can toss that theory into the pond. Quite simply, Escape From Duckov was coded and developed with PC in mind. First and foremost, it’s a PC title, and it needs to be coded differently for PS4 and PS5 consoles.

Can You Play Escape From Duckov On Xbox One or Xbox Series S|X?

It’s the same dilemma for Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S owners as Escape From Duckov isn’t on any Xbox device, but the possibility of it arriving in the future can’t be ruled out.

If Escape From Duckov is a huge success (which it more than likely will be), it would make complete sense for a console release. This means the extraction shooter flying onto PlayStation, as well as Xbox consoles—maybe on Game Pass?

We’ll have to wait and see.

Can You Play Escape From Duckov On Nintendo Switch Or Switch 2?

Nintendo fans are also down bad for Escape From Duckov as the shooter isn’t available on Nintendo Switch or the Switch 2.

It’s pretty much a case of rinse and repeat for Escape From Duckov on either Nintendo generation. Team Soda’s extraction shooter is probably testing the waters on PC first, and then all console ports could arrive later down the line.

Insider Gaming will have the latest news on this as and when it happens.

We’ll have the newest details if Escape From Duckov does get a console port right here. Given that it sold over 200,000 copies in 24 Hours, and still continues to smash it, we don’t see why it won’t happen. Let us know if you’re hoping the game gets a console port through the Insider Gaming Discord.

Also, if you like these types of games, be sure to check out the 5 Best Games Like Escape From Tarkov in 2025.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: EA Shuts Down Call Of Duty-Inspired Battlefield 6 Portal Maps
item.content:encoded:
Electronic Arts (EA) is seemingly shutting down Call of Duty-inspired Battlefield 6 Portal maps.

At least one instance seems to show a map based on the Call of Duty map Shipment. In what appears to be a warning email from EA, the company says that after reviewing the user’s account, it saw content it deemed “inappropriate” due to it referencing “third party products in Battlefield 6.”

When going into more details, the warning specifically mentions “Shipment first test” that had a description of “Shipment 2019 edition”.

The email goes on to say that the user can still play, but any future violations will have restrictions put on the account, such as “temporarily or permanently” removing access to EA games and services.

Insider Gaming has reached out directly to EA and Battlefield Studios for comment on whether they’re removing all references to other games in the Battlefield 6 portal or if it’s specific to Call of Duty. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.

What do you think of EA shutting down Battlefield 6 portal maps that are inspired by Call of Duty? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what game has taken over as the best-selling title in the United States this year. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Was The Best-Selling Game In September
item.content:encoded:
The latest video game sales data for the United States (US) has been announced, and Borderlands 4 was the best-selling game in September 2025.

The new data comes from industry firm Circana, which posted the data ranging from August 31 to October 4.

Following Borderlands 4 for the month was NBA 2K26, which used back-to-back strong months to become the best-selling game of the year so far. Rounding out the top five for September were EA Sports FC 26, Ghost of Yotei, and Madden NFL 26. That means three of the top five games for the month were sports games.

When looking at the full top 20 for the month, nearly half of the games were new releases. Aside from the aforementioned titles above, Silent Hill f, Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, NHL 26, Digimon Story: Time Stranger, and Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 all hit the top 20 for the first time.

You can check out the full list of best-selling games for September below. And be sure to leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Best-Selling Games For September 2025

  1. Borderlands 4 – Take-Two Interactive
  2. NBA 2K26 – Take-Two Interactive
  3. EA Sports FC 26 – Electronic Arts
  4. Ghost of Yotei – Sony
  5. Madden NFL 26 – Electronic Arts
  6. Helldivers II – Sony
  7. Silent Hill: f – Konami Digital Entertainment
  8. Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds – Sega
  9. Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles – Square Enix Inc
  10. Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater – Konami Digital Entertainment
  11. EA Sports College Football 26 – Electronic Arts
  12. NHL 26 – Electronic Arts
  13. Digimon Story: Time Stranger – Bandai Namco Entertainment
  14. Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 – Nintendo
  15. Minecraft – Microsoft
  16. Forza Horizon 5 – Microsoft
  17. Grand Theft Auto V – Take-Two Interactive
  18. Donkey Kong Bananza – Nintendo
  19. Kickoff Bundle (2025) – Electronic Arts
  20. Red Dead Redemption II – Take-Two Interactive

For more Insider Gaming, read about EA nerfing XP farming bot lobbies in Battlefield 6. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
